title: Back extension
instructions: 1. adjust pad to just below your hip bone
2. turn feet out slightly
3. keep a slight bend in your knees to target glutes
4. round your back and use a short range of motion

title: KAS glute bridge
instructions: 1. place feet hip distance apart and rest back on bench
2. as you come up, knees should be at a 90 degree angle and chin should be tucked in
3. go down until you see your knees start to move back towards you

title: RDL (glute biased)
instructions: 1. place a moderate bend in your knees and brace core
2. drive back with your hips, tuck your chin, and keep the weight close to your body
3. once you can't drive your hips back any further, come back up

title: RDL (glute biased)
instructions: 1. place a moderate bend in your knees and brace core
2. drive back with your hips, tuck your chin, and keep the weight close to your body
3. once you can't drive your hips back any further, come back up

title: Step ups (glute biased)
instructions: 1. hinge forward slightly, hold weight in hand opposite of working leg, and hold onto something for balance if needed
2. drive through front foot (back leg is only for support)
3. hinge back, tap back foot down, then come back up

title: Step ups (glute biased)
instructions: 1. hinge forward slightly, hold weight in hand opposite of working leg, and hold onto something for balance if needed
2. drive through front foot (back leg is only for support)
3. hinge back, tap back foot down, then come back up

title: Gorilla rows
instructions: 1. keep a neutral spine and lower hips into a half squat position
2. use core and back to bring one arm up at a time

title: Flat dumbbell bench press
instructions: 1. keep a neutral spine and lower hips into a half squat position
2. use core and back to bring one arm up at a time

title: Decline dumbbell bench press
instructions: 1. keep a neutral spine and lower hips into a half squat position
2. use core and back to bring one arm up at a time
